Module it.polimi.ingsw

Class JoinGameMessage

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.events.messages.Message
it.polimi.ingsw.events.messages.client.ClientMessage
it.polimi.ingsw.events.messages.client.JoinGameMessage
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class JoinGameMessage extends ClientMessage
Message that the client sends when it's trying to connect to an existing game or to create a new one.

  • Constructor Details

    • JoinGameMessage

      public JoinGameMessage(String gameID, boolean creatingGame, int expectedPlayers, String nickname)
      Builds a JoinGameMessage that requests to join an existing game or to create a new one. This message requires a ClientHandler to be effective, because that needs to be linked to be player and to the game, in order to forward updates and accept messages from the client.
      Parameters:
      gameID - the identifier of the game the client's trying to join (if needed)
      creatingGame - true if the client wants to create a new game, false otherwise
      expectedPlayers - if the client's creating a new game, this value represents the number of clients that will play the game
      nickname - the nickname of the client that is trying to join

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute(VirtualMainController mainController, VirtualController controller)
      Tries to add the player to the game (or to create a new game)
      Specified by:
      execute in class ClientMessage
      Parameters:
      mainController - the MainController instance that handles the game the player's playing.
      controller - the GameController that handles the game the player's playing. Which should be null, because the client isn't playing yet.
